laboratory_examinations.findings: On admission: 129/78; maximum recorded after sirolimus withdrawal: 173/89; remained stable afterward in the range of 130/70.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Became hypertensive 24 hours after sirolimus withdrawal; stable during sirolimus reintroduction.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 20/60 in the right eye and 20/40 in the left with an incomplete homonymous hemianopsia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsened on sirolimus reintroduction and improved to the stated findings 3 months later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Essentially unchanged except for diminished density of the hematoma.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Margins of the hematoma became less clear; repeat MRI 61 days after presentation showed resolution of PRES.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild left atrial enlargement; left atrial to aortic ratio of 1.5; septal thickness of 0.74 cm; left ventricular diastolic diameter of 3.98; shortening fraction of 35%; normal diastolic function with long isovolumetric relaxation time of 53 msec.
Hypotrophy of numerous type 1 muscle fibers; apparent absence of type 2B fibers.
